definition: to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to swim/variant of 遊|游[you2]
to walk/to tour/to roam/to travel
surname You
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 蕩|荡[dang4]
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]
Ein Gespenst geht um in Europa./the opening sentence of Marx and Engels' "Communist Manifesto"
pinyin: Yi1 ge4 you1 ling2 zai4 Ou1 zhou1 you2 dang4

sentences.english: So in the interest of helping out the next generation of thieves, I'm going to offer you a few pointers.
sentences.chinese: 所以，为了有助于下一代游荡者们，我准备教你几招。

sentences.english: We found people wandering like ghosts through the ruins .
sentences.chinese: 孤魂野鬼一样的人们在废墟里游荡。

sentences.english: People walked through the streets aimlessly with nowhere to go, carrying the few bags and possessions they had left.
sentences.chinese: 人们带着仅剩的财物包裹漫无目的游荡。

sentences.english: We need to cough up the goop and not let it just hang out in the back of the throat.).
sentences.chinese: 我们需要这种糊状物质，不让他在咽喉里游荡。

sentences.english: On average throughout all the quarter-million responses, minds were wandering 47 percent of the time.
sentences.chinese: 在25万回应中，平均下来思绪47%的时间在游荡。

sentences.english: The survivors wandered about the jungle for days before being picked up by a search party.
sentences.chinese: 幸存者在丛林中游荡了好几天，才被搜索队救出来。

sentences.english: They wandered the world and found half- made human beings.
sentences.chinese: 他们在世界上游荡并创造出人类的半成品。

sentences.english: Christlike vagrant wanders through a perverse and grotesque land filled with religious and sacrilegious imagery.
sentences.chinese: 像督流浪满宗教渎圣象异堕落游荡。

sentences.english: All love to be out by the light of the moon.
sentences.chinese: 它们都爱在月光下出来游荡。

sentences.english: When it was time for his appointment he drifted uptown to the club entrance.
sentences.chinese: 快到约会的时间，他游游荡荡地向夜总会的大门走去。

sentences.english: Drunken youths hang around outside looking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 喝醉的年轻人在街头游荡，酗酒滋事。

sentences.english: Thin, hungry dogs roamed the streets.
sentences.chinese: 又瘦又饿的狗在街上游荡。

sentences.english: But stop and loiter all the time, to sing it in extatic songs.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔懒了游荡而已，哼着歌曲说说梦呓。

sentences.english: And there would be some strange people hanging out.
sentences.chinese: 会有一些奇奇怪怪的人在那里游荡。

sentences.english: And I am told that it is haunted by the Ghost of Might-have-Been.
sentences.chinese: 我听说这栋房子里游荡着一个叫做“没准”的鬼魂。

sentences.english: He also walked the streets by himself, observing and thinking.
sentences.chinese: 他也会一个人游荡在街头，一边观察和思考。

definition: to rock/to sway/to shake
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
aimless/at random
to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
wandering/unfixed/to migrate
to roll/to wander around/to appear repeatedly
to go through/to bore through/to push one's way through
to travel back and forth/to shuttle
to cruise
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
to swing/to sway/to wobble/to hang around/to hover around
to stroll
to come and go/to roam about (mostly unseen)/(of a ghost) to haunt (a place)/(of a criminal) to stalk (the streets)/(of the sun) to rise and set
to flee in disarray/to scatter
variant of 飄盪|飘荡[piao1 dang4]
to float/to hover/to drift (also fig., to lead a wandering life)/to rove/showy/superficial
